#!/usr/bin/env python3
import shutil
import os
from datetime import datetime
from pathlib import Path

def backup_directory(source_dir, backup_dir):
    """Create a timestamped backup of a directory."""
    source = Path(source_dir)
    backup_base = Path(backup_dir)
    
    if not source.exists():
        print(f"Error: Source directory not found: {source}")
        return None
    
    # Create backup directory if it doesn't exist
    backup_base.mkdir(parents=True, exist_ok=True)
    
    # Create timestamped backup name
    timestamp = datetime.now().strftime('%Y%m%d_%H%M%S')
    backup_name = f"{source.name}_backup_{timestamp}"
    backup_path = backup_base / backup_name
    
    print(f"Creating backup: {backup_path}")
    print(f"Source: {source}")
    print(f"Size: {get_dir_size(source) / (1024**2):.2f} MB\n")
    
    # Create backup
    shutil.copytree(source, backup_path)
    
    print(f"âœ“ Backup created successfully!")
    print(f"Location: {backup_path}")
    
    return backup_path

def backup_to_archive(source_dir, backup_dir, format='zip'):
    """Create a compressed backup archive."""
    source = Path(source_dir)
    backup_base = Path(backup_dir)
    
    backup_base.mkdir(parents=True, exist_ok=True)
    
    timestamp = datetime.now().strftime('%Y%m%d_%H%M%S')
    archive_name = f"{source.name}_backup_{timestamp}"
    archive_path = backup_base / archive_name
    
    print(f"Creating compressed backup: {archive_path}.{format}")
    
    # Create archive (zip, tar, gztar, bztar, xztar)
    shutil.make_archive(str(archive_path), format, source)
    
    archive_file = f"{archive_path}.{format}"
    archive_size = os.path.getsize(archive_file) / (1024**2)
    
    print(f"âœ“ Archive created: {archive_file}")
    print(f"Size: {archive_size:.2f} MB")
    
    return archive_file

def get_dir_size(path):
    """Calculate total size of directory."""
    total = 0
    for entry in Path(path).rglob('*'):
        if entry.is_file():
            total += entry.stat().st_size
    return total

def cleanup_old_backups(backup_dir, keep_days=7):
    """Remove backups older than keep_days."""
    from datetime import timedelta
    
    backup_path = Path(backup_dir)
    cutoff_time = datetime.now() - timedelta(days=keep_days)
    
    removed = 0
    for item in backup_path.iterdir():
        if item.is_file() or item.is_dir():
            mtime = datetime.fromtimestamp(item.stat().st_mtime)
            if mtime < cutoff_time:
                print(f"Removing old backup: {item.name}")
                if item.is_file():
                    item.unlink()
                else:
                    shutil.rmtree(item)
                removed += 1
    
    print(f"\nâœ“ Removed {removed} old backups")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import sys
    
    if len(sys.argv) < 3:
        print("Usage: python3 backup_files.py <source_dir> <backup_dir>")
        sys.exit(1)
    
    source = sys.argv[1]
    backup = sys.argv[2]
    
    # Create compressed backup
    backup_to_archive(source, backup, format='zip')
    
    # Cleanup old backups
    cleanup_old_backups(backup, keep_days=7)

#!/usr/bin/env python3
import smtplib
from email.mime.text import MIMEText
from email.mime.multipart import MIMEMultipart
from email.mime.base import MIMEBase
from email import encoders
import os

class EmailSender:
    def __init__(self, smtp_server, smtp_port, username, password):
        self.smtp_server = smtp_server
        self.smtp_port = smtp_port
        self.username = username
        self.password = password
    
    def send_email(self, to_email, subject, body, attachments=None):
        """Send an email with optional attachments."""
        msg = MIMEMultipart()
        msg['From'] = self.username
        msg['To'] = to_email
        msg['Subject'] = subject
        
        # Add body
        msg.attach(MIMEText(body, 'plain'))
        
        # Add attachments
        if attachments:
            for file_path in attachments:
                if os.path.exists(file_path):
                    with open(file_path, 'rb') as f:
                        part = MIMEBase('application', 'octet-stream')
                        part.set_payload(f.read())
                        encoders.encode_base64(part)
                        part.add_header(
                            'Content-Disposition',
                            f'attachment; filename={os.path.basename(file_path)}'
                        )
                        msg.attach(part)
        
        try:
            # Connect to server
            print(f"Connecting to {self.smtp_server}:{self.smtp_port}...")
            
            if self.smtp_port == 587:
                server = smtplib.SMTP(self.smtp_server, self.smtp_port)
                server.starttls()
            else:
                server = smtplib.SMTP_SSL(self.smtp_server, self.smtp_port)
            
            server.login(self.username, self.password)
            
            # Send email
            server.send_message(msg)
            server.quit()
            
            print(f"âœ“ Email sent to {to_email}")
            return True
            
        except Exception as e:
            print(f"âœ— Failed to send email: {e}")
            return False

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import sys
    
    # Example usage
    # For Gmail: smtp.gmail.com:587, use App Password
    # For Outlook: smtp-mail.outlook.com:587
    
    if len(sys.argv) < 6:
        print("Usage: python3 send_email.py <smtp_server> <port> <username> <password> <to_email> <subject> <body>")
        print("\nExample (Gmail):")
        print("  python3 send_email.py smtp.gmail.com 587 you@gmail.com 'app_password' recipient@example.com 'Test' 'Hello!'")
        sys.exit(1)
    
    smtp_server = sys.argv[1]
    smtp_port = int(sys.argv[2])
    username = sys.argv[3]
    password = sys.argv[4]
    to_email = sys.argv[5]
    subject = sys.argv[6] if len(sys.argv) > 6 else "Test Email"
    body = sys.argv[7] if len(sys.argv) > 7 else "This is a test email from Python."
    
    sender = EmailSender(smtp_server, smtp_port, username, password)
    sender.send_email(to_email, subject, body)

#!/usr/bin/env python3
import shutil
import os
from datetime import datetime
from pathlib import Path
import smtplib
from email.mime.text import MIMEText
from email.mime.multipart import MIMEMultipart

def backup_with_report(source_dir, backup_dir, email_config=None):
    """Backup directory and send email report."""
    timestamp = datetime.now().strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S')
    
    print(f"Starting backup at {timestamp}\n")
    
    source = Path(source_dir)
    backup_base = Path(backup_dir)
    
    # Create backup
    backup_timestamp = datetime.now().strftime('%Y%m%d_%H%M%S')
    archive_name = f"{source.name}_backup_{backup_timestamp}"
    archive_path = backup_base / archive_name
    
    backup_base.mkdir(parents=True, exist_ok=True)
    
    print("Creating backup...")
    archive_file = shutil.make_archive(str(archive_path), 'zip', source)
    
    # Get backup stats
    archive_size = os.path.getsize(archive_file) / (1024**2)
    
    print(f"âœ“ Backup created: {archive_file}")
    print(f"Size: {archive_size:.2f} MB\n")
    
    # Create report
    report = f"""Backup Report - {timestamp}
=====================================

Source: {source}
Backup: {archive_file}
Size: {archive_size:.2f} MB
Status: SUCCESS

Backup completed successfully!
"""
    
    print(report)
    
    # Send email if configured
    if email_config:
        print("Sending email report...")
        send_report_email(email_config, "Backup Report", report, [archive_file])
    
    return archive_file

def send_report_email(config, subject, body, attachments=None):
    """Send email report."""
    msg = MIMEMultipart()
    msg['From'] = config['username']
    msg['To'] = config['to_email']
    msg['Subject'] = f"[BACKUP] {subject} - {datetime.now().strftime('%Y-%m-%d')}" 
    
    msg.attach(MIMEText(body, 'plain'))
    
    try:
        server = smtplib.SMTP(config['smtp_server'], config['smtp_port'])
        server.starttls()
        server.login(config['username'], config['password'])
        server.send_message(msg)
        server.quit()
        
        print(f"âœ“ Email sent to {config['to_email']}")
    except Exception as e:
        print(f"âœ— Email failed: {e}")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import sys
    
    if len(sys.argv) < 3:
        print("Usage: python3 backup_and_notify.py <source_dir> <backup_dir>")
        sys.exit(1)
    
    source = sys.argv[1]
    backup = sys.argv[2]
    
    # Optional: Configure email
    email_config = None
    if os.environ.get('SMTP_SERVER'):
        email_config = {
            'smtp_server': os.environ.get('SMTP_SERVER'),
            'smtp_port': int(os.environ.get('SMTP_PORT', 587)),
            'username': os.environ.get('SMTP_USERNAME'),
            'password': os.environ.get('SMTP_PASSWORD'),
            'to_email': os.environ.get('REPORT_EMAIL')
        }
    
    backup_with_report(source, backup, email_config)

#!/usr/bin/env python3
import schedule
import time
import shutil
from datetime import datetime
from pathlib import Path

def backup_task(source, destination):
    """Backup task to be scheduled."""
    timestamp = datetime.now().strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S')
    print(f"\n[{timestamp}] Running scheduled backup...")
    
    try:
        backup_timestamp = datetime.now().strftime('%Y%m%d_%H%M%S')
        source_path = Path(source)
        dest_path = Path(destination)
        
        dest_path.mkdir(parents=True, exist_ok=True)
        
        archive_name = f"{source_path.name}_backup_{backup_timestamp}"
        archive_path = dest_path / archive_name
        
        archive_file = shutil.make_archive(str(archive_path), 'zip', source)
        size = Path(archive_file).stat().st_size / (1024**2)
        
        print(f"âœ“ Backup completed: {archive_file} ({size:.2f} MB)")
        
    except Exception as e:
        print(f"âœ— Backup failed: {e}")

def cleanup_task(backup_dir, keep_days=7):
    """Cleanup old backups."""
    from datetime import timedelta
    
    print(f"\n[{datetime.now().strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S')}] Cleaning old backups...")
    
    backup_path = Path(backup_dir)
    cutoff_time = datetime.now() - timedelta(days=keep_days)
    
    removed = 0
    for item in backup_path.glob('*'):
        if item.is_file():
            mtime = datetime.fromtimestamp(item.stat().st_mtime)
            if mtime < cutoff_time:
                item.unlink()
                removed += 1
                print(f"  Removed: {item.name}")
    
    print(f"âœ“ Cleanup complete: {removed} old backups removed")

def main():
    """Main scheduling loop."""
    import sys
    
    if len(sys.argv) < 3:
        print("Usage: python3 scheduled_backup.py <source_dir> <backup_dir>")
        sys.exit(1)
    
    source = sys.argv[1]
    backup = sys.argv[2]
    
    print("Backup Scheduler Started")
    print("=" * 50)
    print(f"Source: {source}")
    print(f"Backup: {backup}")
    print("\nSchedule:")
    print("  - Backup: Every day at 02:00")
    print("  - Cleanup: Every Sunday at 03:00")
    print("  - Quick backup: Every 6 hours")
    print("\nPress Ctrl+C to stop\n")
    
    # Schedule tasks
    schedule.every().day.at("02:00").do(backup_task, source, backup)
    schedule.every().sunday.at("03:00").do(cleanup_task, backup, keep_days=7)
    schedule.every(6).hours.do(backup_task, source, backup)
    
    # For testing: run every minute
    # schedule.every(1).minutes.do(backup_task, source, backup)
    
    # Run scheduling loop
    try:
        while True:
            schedule.run_pending()
            time.sleep(60)  # Check every minute
    except KeyboardInterrupt:
        print("\n\nScheduler stopped.")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    main()

        archive_path = dest / archive_name
        
        shutil.make_archive(str(archive_path), 'zip', source)
        print(f"âœ“ Backup completed: {archive_path}.zip")
    
    def cleanup(self):
        """Cleanup old backups."""
        print(f"\n[{datetime.now()}] Cleaning old backups...")
        # Implementation here

    def start(self):
        """Start automation suite."""

        # Setup schedules
